required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Comprehensive Patient-centered Health Service in Cystic Fibrosis (VEMSE-CF)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Comprehensive Patient-centered Health Service With a Focus on Psychosocial Services for Patients With Rare Diseases Using Cystic Fibrosis as an Example (Evaluation Eines Ganzheitlichen Patientenzentrierten Versorgungsmodells für Patienten Mit Seltenen Erkrankungen Unter Besonderer Berücksichtigung Der Psychosozialen Versorgung am Beispiel Mukoviszidose)

collaborator.agency: Medical Association of Lower Saxony (Ärztekammer Niedersachsen), Germany

brief_summary.textblock: For the Project VEMSE-CF, a comprehensive patient-centered outpatient health service model was developed offering focused interventions in different areas. These included patient education, as well as nutritional and exercise counselling. Special emphasis was given to the psycho-social services. The implementation was supported by a case manager. The model was implemented in three German CF-Centers. For evaluation, Patient data from 13 additional German CF-Centers offering standard care was used as comparison. In total, 153 patients in the Intervention Group and 163 control patients aged 5-52 years contributed data. The primary endpoint was the number of BMI- and FEV1-measurements over 24 months. Secondary endpoints included mortality, lung transplantation, FEV1, BMI, adherence to therapy, Quality of life, and mental stress.

study_design_info.masking_description: there was no masking of patients or outcome assessors

primary_outcome.measure: Number of BMI and FEV1 assessments
primary_outcome.description: crude number of assessments (BMI and FEV1) performed during the study period

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients deceased during the study period
number of patients referred for lung Transplantation during the study
Change in FEV1 from baseline to end of study
Change in BMI from baseline to end of study
Number of outpatient visits during study period
number of hospitalizations during the study period

other_outcome.measure: Delta Proportion of patients with subnormal FEV1
other_outcome.description: Change in the Proportion of patients with an FEV1<80% predicted

other_outcome.measure: Delta Proportion of Patients with well preserved BMI
other_outcome.description: Change in the Proportion of patients with a BMI equal or greater 22 kg/m2 (females) or 23 kg/m2 (males)
Performance of planned assessments (four per year; eight during intervention)
Self- or proxy-Report of patients´ Quality of Life: questionnaire - EQ5D (adults) / EQ5D - Y (13-18) / CFQ-R-6-12; three assessments during intervention (begin / after 12 month /after 24 month)
self-report of parents´ Quality of Life; questionnaire - EY5D; three assessments during intervention(begin / after 12 month /after 24 month)
Self- or proxy-Report of patients´ emotional stress; questionnaire - Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS); three assessments during Intervention (begin / after 12 month /after 24 month)

arm_group.description: comprehensive patient-centered outpatient health service with multiple components. These components included the addition of a case-manager, structured interventions to improve patient education and adherence to therapy, psychological counselling, social services, and exercise advice. For each Patient, relevant components were identified and a written Intervention plan was negotiated and signed.

intervention.intervention_name: comprehensive patient-centered outpatient health service with multiple components
intervention.description: Individualized multi-component education and counselling program coordinated by a case Manager.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed diagnosis of Cystic Fibrosis - written informed consent
- intervention group: care in one of the 3 CF-centers
- control group: care in one of the 13 control CF-centers
Exclusion Criteria:
- post lung Transplantation
- listed for lung Transplantation and planned inpatient stay for more than 4 weeks

reference.citation: Besier T, Born A, Henrich G, Hinz A, Quittner AL, Goldbeck L; TIDES Study Group. Anxiety, depression, and life satisfaction in parents caring for children with cystic fibrosis. Pediatr Pulmonol. 2011 Jul;46(7):672-82. doi: 10.1002/ppul.21423. Epub 2011 Mar 7.

The longitudinal BELLA study: design, methods and first results on the course of mental health problems. Eur Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2015 Jun;24(6):651-63. doi: 10.1007/s00787-014-0638-4. Epub 2014 Nov 27.
